Class Main

java.lang.Object
Main
public class Main extends Object
The Main class begins here where the actual program will run. The program allows the user to add, edit, display and delete information from the associated database. The main class also contains methods which prompt the user and receive user inputs.
Version:
1.00 09 July 2024
Author:
Connor Wallace

    • enterNewProjectOption

      public static void enterNewProjectOption(Scanner sc, String userInput, Person architect, Person customer, Person contractor, ResultSet results, Statement statement, Project project, ProjectAddressHandler projectAddressHandler, Prompt prompt, PersonHandler personHandler) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to enter a new project on the initial prompt. It will get information regarding the project from the user and enter it into the database.
      Parameters:
      sc - object to get user inputs
      userInput - user's input
      architect - architect person object
      customer - customer person object
      contractor - contractor person object
      results - object which stores queried data
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      project - project object
      projectAddressHandler - object which handles project address information
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      personHandler - object which handles person information
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • searchProjectOption

      public static void searchProjectOption(Project project, String userInput, Scanner sc, ResultSet results, Prompt prompt, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to search for a project. It will ask the user if they want search by project number or name. Then it will present the user with the projects. The user will be prompted to enter the name or project number of the project they want, then the information for that project will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      project - project object
      userInput - user's input
      sc - object to get user inputs
      results - object which stores queried data
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • searchPersonOption

      public static void searchPersonOption(Scanner sc, String userInput, Prompt prompt, PersonHandler personHandler, Person customer, Person architect, Person contractor, ResultSet results, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to search for a person on the initial prompt. The user will be will asked what kind of person they want to search for. After chooses a type of person, the user will be shown all the people of that type stored and be prompted to enter an ID. Once they have done so, that person's information will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      sc - object to get user inputs
      userInput - user's input
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      personHandler - object which handles person information
      customer - customer person object
      architect - architect person object
      contractor - contractor person object
      results - object which stores queried data
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • deleteProjectOption

      public static void deleteProjectOption(Project project, ResultSet results, Statement statement, String userInput, Scanner sc, Prompt prompt) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to delete a project at the initial prompt. The user will be shown all the project and be asked to enter the project number of one they want to delete. After doing so, the user will be asked if they are sure they want to delete this project. If yes, it will be deleted, if no, it will not.
      Parameters:
      project - project object
      results - object which stores queried data
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      userInput - user's input
      sc - object to get user inputs
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • deletePersonPromptOption

      public static void deletePersonPromptOption(Prompt prompt, String userInput, Scanner sc, ResultSet results, Person customer, Person architect, Person contractor, Project project, Statement statement, PersonHandler personHandler) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to delete a person from the database. The person will first be prompted to choose a person type, they will then be shown all the people of that type and be prompted to enter the ID of the one to delete. If the person is associated with any projects, the user will be shown which projects they are associated with and be told they are not allowed to delete the person as they are associated with one or more projects. After doing so, the user will be asked if they are sure they want to delete this person. If yes, it will be deleted, if no, it will not.
      Parameters:
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      userInput - user's input
      sc - object to get user inputs
      results - object which stores queried data
      customer - customer person object
      architect - architect person object
      contractor - contractor person object
      project - project object
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      personHandler - object which handles person object information
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • deleteProjectAddressOption

      public static void deleteProjectAddressOption(Project project, ProjectAddressHandler projectAddressHandler, String userInput, Scanner sc, ResultSet results, Statement statement, Prompt prompt) throws SQLException
      Method for if the user chooses to delete a project address from the initial prompt. The user will be shown a list of the project address in the database and be prompted to choose one based on ID. After doing so, if the project address is associated with a project, the user will be told they cannot delete the project address as it is associated with one or more projects. They will be show a list of projects that the address is associated with. If the address is not associated with any projects, the user will be asked if they are sure they want to delete the address. If yes, it will be deleted, if no, it will not.
      Parameters:
      project - project object
      projectAddressHandler - object which handles project address information
      userInput - user's input
      sc - object to get user inputs
      results - object which stores queried data
      statement - object which queries and updates the database
      prompt - object containing prompts and checks user inputs
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs
